Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Iceberg \Ice"berg`\, n. [Prob. of Scand. origin; cf. Dan. iisbierg, Sw. isberg, properly, a mountain of ice. See {Ice}, and {Berg}.] A large mass of ice, generally floating in the ocean. [1913 Webster]
Note: Icebergs are large detached portions of glaciers, which in cold regions often project into the sea. [1913 Webster]

iceberg n 1: a large mass of ice floating at sea; usually broken off of a polar glacier [syn: {berg}] 2: lettuce with crisp tightly packed light-green leaves in a firm head; "iceberg is still the most popular lettuce" [syn: {crisphead lettuce}, {iceberg lettuce}]
